lines.text: Yeah, tracking down this Hamilton doll, I uncovered a nest of fifth columnists - fivers ? spies to you! Pepi was one of them, that's what Joe found out, and that'swhy Pepi knocked him off.
Well, if that's on the level, what are you telling me for? Why don't you spill it to the cops?

I tried to, but no soap. Now listen, Marty, I know you're no mental giant, but try to juggle this... all of you. I got a firsthand report tonight on what it's like on the other side, from that Hamilton babe. And brother, I'm telling you, we gotta watch our steps. Those babies are strictly no good from way down deep. They're no bunch of petty racketeers trying to muscle in on some small territory - they want to move in wholesale, take over the whole country.
So what? It don't make no difference to me who runs the country, as long as they stay out of my way.
That's just it, they're not going to stay out of your way.
Oh, yes, they will.

Oh, now listen, big shot, they'll tell you what time you get up in the morning and what time you go to bed at night. They'll tell you what you eat, what kind of clothes you can wear, what you drink. They'll even tell you the morning paper you can read.
They can't do that, it's against the law!
[to reporters]
Well, I... I feel a little like the princess who has been rescued from the dragon by the white knight.
Oh, that's you, Gloves! You're the white knight!
[laughter]
Wait a minute, wait a minute! Anybody that prints that can expect the usual trouble.
[laughter]
What else? Go ahead.
Well, I also feel it's about time someone knocked the axis back on its heels.
Excuse me, baby. What she means is, it's about time somebody knocked those heels back on their axis!
I wish I was on 42nd Street.
Why 42nd Street?
So I could catch the subway home.
You realize you will never get out of here. Every entrance is guarded.
Aaah, don't try that line on me, Jack. This is Broadway, not Berlin!
It's a great pity, Mr. Donahue, that you and I should oppose each other. We have so much in common.
Yeah? How's that?
You are a man of action. You take what you want, and so do we. You have no respect for democracy - neither do we. It's clear we should be allies.

It's clear you are screwy. I've been a refistered Democrat ever since I could vote. I may not be Model Citizen Number One, but I pay my taxes, wait for traffic lights, and buy 24 tickets to the Policeman's Ball. Brother, don't get me mixed up in no league that rubs out innocent bakers and...
[Shoots an alarm buzzer thar Ebbing was about to push]

[Taken aback by the accuracy of the shot]
Excellent! Did you learn that in one of your gang wars?
No, that's a little trick I picked up in Benny's Shootin' Gallery in Coney Island, and if you don't quit stallin', I'll show you some other tricks I learned in Brooklyn.
[on viewing portrait of Hitler]
I recognize the face, but I don't know where to put it.
Any message?
Should I leave out the curse words?
Yeah.
No message.

[Sneaking through villains' hideout]
Hmm. What kind of radio is that?
That's a short wave outfit.
What goes on here?
I don't know. I don't get it. Hold on.
[Moves cigarette lighter, revealing portrait of Adolf Hitler on wall]
Aha!
Mm-hm! Schickelgruber, the house painter!
Yeah, I recognize the face but I don't know where to put it. Hey, there's more here than meets the F. B. I.
Say, chief, can't I get away just long enough to give my girl a quick hello?
No, stick around, will ya?
What are you so nervous about? She'll keep!
That's what you think. I can't take a chance. The fleet's in and she's defense-minded!
Hello officer.
This your cab?
Yes, sir.
Better move it outta' here before somebody takes it away from ya'.
I'm waiting for a fare.
Hang around. You'll get one. Ain't a night goes by that we don't drag a stiff or two out of the river.
Say, there's more here than meets the FBI.

I start out the evening with a nice poker game in view and wind up in Central Park playing Cowboys and Indians. Now I don't know where I am. How about that! Me, in the middle of New York City, lost in the woods.
[Gloves and Ebbing are in a boat filled with explosives]
You're not afraid to die, are you?
I don't mind dying, but I hate to be divided up into small pieces.
That friend of yours; how is he?
Fine! He's dead.
[Gloves and Sunshine, taken captive, are put in together]
That you, Sunshine?
If it ain't, I've been doing a lot of suffering for the wrong party.
[seeing wall maps at the spies' headquarters]
Principal airways... arterial highways...
Looks like Public School 167. I got expelled from there.
[Sunshine knocks out a Nazi with an ax handle]
Very good. Joe DiMaggio couldn't have done better.
I used to bat .320 at reform school.

[to reporters]
Well, I also feel it's about time someone knocked the Axis back on its heels.
Excuse me, Baby. What she means it's about time someone knocked those heels back on their axis.

[to the waiter]
When I order cheesecake, I don't expect to get mucilage!
Do you remember anything else from your youth?
Yeah, but they gave me three years to forget.
Nice cheerful little neighborhood. My friend got his skull crushed down here last week.
For what?
For nuthin'!
The first one of those guys I tag, I'm gonna kick'm right in the swastika.

[Eating a sandwich]
I don't grasp it. Maybe I'm not big enough mentally.
Listen, if you don't stop munchin' that sandwich and throw that feeble brain of yours into high gear, those guys are gonna hi-jack the Statue of Liberty. C'mon, Forbes, I'll show ya da hideout.
Okay, I'm no prude. I'd like to see this den of boogeymen.
[to other police as he is walking out of the office]
Now don't let anyone take that sandwich...
[Pointing to his sergeant]
and that goes for you too!

[to Leda]
I not only dislike you; I distrust you.
Shut up, the guy's dead.
Well, I'm reasonably sorry.
If you only had kept out of this. You've messed up everything.
I'm ashamed of myself.
You're like a bad penny.
I don't get it. I marry Annabelle and I spend my honeymoon with you.
Well, I can cook.

[Breaking into building]
Personally, I'd feel more comfortable if I had a rod.
Here lies Sunshine under the sod. That's not odd. He had no rod.
You know, there are times when I wonder about you.

[attempting to untie the rope he'd been tied up with]
These knots must'a been tied by the No. 1 boy scout!

[holding a fire ax]
If you hear a blow-out, you'll know I've bumped into Goring.
[Goring was well known for his corpulence]
